page.title: 13Everyday Life, Eccleston
page.content: I get up at seven a.m., but I am not the first. My dad starts his milk round at four a.m.,delivering milk to people's homes. We have a farm shop and nursery,where we sell fruit,vegetables, dairy produce,garden plants and trees. We buy most of the goods from wholesalers. My grandfather keeps horses and sheep on some of our land. Both of my parents used to be teachers,and taught in Jamaica for two years.I am called Gareth.I am ten years old,and my sister Jane is eight.We set off for school at 8.30 a.m.,leaving my mother to look after the shop. At 9a.m. my dad arrives home from his milk round,and works in the nursery.
